title: Good Health for Back to School

content.en: It's back to school for you! But! It's also back to catching colds... More sneezing and coughing are around you! But there are many ways to stay healthy.
content.tw: 嘿!該是你們回學校上課的時候囉! 但是隨著開學，越來越多身邊的人咳嗽和打噴嚏，你們也更加容易感冒，不過，有很多保持健康的好方法哦。

content.en: Listen up! What's the first thing to do before you eat? Well, you wash your hands! Using soap is important. You can't see the germs and viruses on your hands. But germs and viruses can make you sick. Water doesn't kill them... Soap kills them! When there's no soap and water, find some hand sanitizer.
content.tw: 聽著，吃飯前該做的第一件事情是什麼呢? 就是用肥皂洗手! 你看不到讓你生病的細菌和病毒，所以要用肥皂或是乾洗手消滅它們!

content.en: Next, eat healthy foods! Vegetables, fruits, and whole grains are good for you. Don't be picky! Take a bite of broccoli. One bite is better than no broccoli!
content.tw: 下一步就是要吃健康的食物! 蔬菜、水果還有全榖根莖類都會幫助你，不要挑剔唷! 咬一口花椰菜吧! 總比都沒有吃花椰菜來的好。

content.en: Finally, at the end of the day, it's bedtime. Thirty minutes before bedtime, turn off your TV and your computer. Put away your phone. That can help you sleep better. Get lots of sleep. Your body needs to rest and get ready for a new day!
content.tw: 最後，到了睡覺時間! 睡前 30 分鐘要關上電視、電腦，還有把手機拿開，這可以幫助你睡得更好，讓身體休息並為隔天做準備。

content.en: Wash your hands, eat healthy foods, and get lots of sleep, okay? Stay healthy out there, kids! Now, with clean hands, eat lunch!
content.tw: 洗手、吃健康的食物，並獲得充足的睡眠，好嗎？ 孩子們，保持健康！ 現在，洗乾淨手，吃午餐吧！

vocabulary.preface: 開學了，正是培養健康生活習慣的好時機。

content.text: 1. bite 咬。 Wow, what's this? 哇，這是什麼? Shrimp cooked with peas.蝦仁炒豌豆。 Here, take a bite. 來吃一口。 Hmmm, this is really tasty! 這真好吃! Yeah? You like it? 是嗎? 你很喜歡?
2. healthy 健康的。 I sure do.我很喜歡。 Good! It's easy to cook, and very healthy too. 真好，它很容易做，又很健康。 Low in calories.熱量又低。
3. better than 比什麼好。 Can I have more? 我可以再多吃一點嗎? Of course, you can have half of it.當然，你可以吃一半。 This is definitely better than hamburgers. 這絕對比漢堡好。
4. picky 挑剔的。 You're not picky, are you? 你不挑剔，對吧? Not at all. I'll eat whatever dishes you make. 一點也不，你做什麼我都吃。

title: The Smartest Orangutan

content.en: Orangutans are smart apes. Sadly, there aren't many of them. Their rainforest homes are getting too small. They live in Indonesia and Malaysia. These countries are south of Taiwan.
content.tw: 紅毛猩猩是聰明的人猿。可惜牠們越來越少，因為居住的雨林越來越小。牠們住在東南亞國家印尼跟馬來西亞。

content.en: Did you know orangutan means "forest person"? They live in trees. Their long arms help them go from tree to tree!
content.tw: orangutan 的意思是「森林裡的人」。牠們就住在森林裡，長長的手臂可以讓牠們在樹跟樹之間擺盪。

content.en: One day, two orangutans had a fight. One orangutan's cheek got a big wound. Ouch!
content.tw: 有一天，兩隻紅毛猩猩打架，其中一隻的臉頰上出現很大的傷口。

content.en: Scientists saw him get some leaves. He chewed them. But he didn't eat them. He made juice... in his mouth!
content.tw: 科學家看到這隻紅毛猩猩採了葉子，牠沒有吃下去而是咀嚼，把葉子的汁液留在嘴巴裡。

content.en: He put the juice on his wound. Then he put the chewed leaves on the wound. The leaves were like a bandage!
content.tw: 牠把汁液敷在傷口上，再把嚼過的葉子當繃帶保護傷口。

content.en: The next day, the scientists saw him get new leaves. He put juice and chewed leaves on his wound again. His wound got better!
content.tw: 隔天科學家又看到牠做同樣的事，而且牠的傷口好多了。

content.en: The scientists were surprised! They had watched orangutans for twenty years. But they did not see other orangutans do this. How did this orangutan learn? The scientists don't know.
content.tw: 科學家很驚訝，他們觀察紅毛猩猩20年，從來沒有看過這種行為。那這隻紅毛猩猩從哪裡學的呢? 他們也不知道。

content.en: But the scientists are happy. Maybe people will care about orangutans now! How about you?
content.tw: 但科學家很高興。或許現在人們會關心紅毛猩猩了！你呢？

vocabulary.preface: 紅毛猩猩懂得用植物來醫治傷口，這可聰明了!

content.text:
1. country 國家.
Which country has the most orangutans? 哪個國家有最多紅毛猩猩?
Let's see… Brazil? 我想想看。巴西嗎?
It has the biggest rainforest. 它有最大的雨林.

2. forest 森林.
Nope. Guess again. 不對，再猜。
They do live in forests, right? 牠們確實住在森林裡吧?
That's right. 對。
Then Thailand. 那是泰國.

3. smart 聰明的.
No, no. But you're getting closer.不對，不過靠近了。
Okay, this is my last try. Myanmar. 好吧，這是最後一次猜。緬甸。
You're smart, but still no. 真聰明，但還是錯了.

4. ape 猿猴.
Tell me.告訴我。
I'll let you find it out. 我讓你自己找。
Those apes…Where can they go? 那些猿猴能去哪兒?

title: Boy Gets Stuck in Claw Machine

content.en: I'm at an arcade!
content.tw: 我人在遊樂場！

content.en: They have lots of driving games! But they make me carsick.
content.tw: 我人在遊樂場，這裡有好多賽車遊戲，但我會暈車。

content.en: Look! Over there! They have fighting games! Ugh… they're too scary for me!
content.tw: 還有槍戰遊戲，但我覺得有一點恐怖。

content.en: I know! I'm going over there to the claw machines!
content.tw: 我知道了！我要去那邊玩夾娃娃機！

content.en: Do you know what a claw machine is? Taiwan has lots!
content.tw: 你知道夾娃娃機是什麼嗎？台灣有很多！

content.en: A claw machine looks like a big glass box. There's always a prize in it! The prize can be a toy, candy, or sometimes something expensive! Players can win a cell phone from some claw machines!
content.tw: 我要去玩夾娃娃機。它像個大玻璃櫃，獎品有玩具、糖果，還可能有很貴的東西，像是手機！

content.en: To win a prize, a player picks it up with a claw. The claw is a metal robot hand. Picking up the prize sounds easy doesn't it? But it's very hard!
content.tw: 你需要控制金屬爪子去夾獎品，聽起來很簡單，其實不容易。

content.en: A boy played a claw machine. But he didn't win. What did he do then? He climbed inside it. He wanted to take the prize!
content.tw: 一個男孩玩夾娃娃機，但他沒有夾到。然後他做了什麼？他爬了進去，他想要拿走獎品！

content.en: But then the boy got stuck in the claw machine!
content.tw: 有一個男孩夾不到獎品，就爬進娃娃機裡面，結果卡在裡面出不來！

content.en: Some people got him out safely. But now he cannot play that claw machine for one whole year!
content.tw: 後來大家把他安全救出來，但是他一整年不能再玩夾娃娃機了。

content.en: Hmm … I want a prize too. But I won't climb inside! I'll play the right way… wish me luck!
content.tw: 嗯…我也想要一個獎品。但我不會爬進去！我會用正確的方式玩…祝我好運！

vocabulary.preface: 夾不到獎品的小男孩，乾脆爬進夾娃娃機的玻璃櫃裡。

content.text:
1. prize 獎品。
Wait, I want to play this one. 等一下，我要玩這個。
You're such a child, Paz. 你真是個小孩。
Look at all these prizes. 你看這些獎品。
They are so much fun! 都很好玩呢.

2. toy 玩具。
They are just cheap toys. 它們都只是些便宜玩具。
You're not still playing with toys, are you? 你沒有在玩玩具了吧?

3. pick up 撿起來。
I am. And I like cheap toys. 我有，我喜歡便宜玩具。
Now I have to pick up this car. 現在我一定要夾這個汽車.

4. over there 在那裏。
Oh no! Why is it so hard? 糟糕，怎麼這麼難?
Come on. Let me buy you ice cream at the store over there.
來吧，我請你到那邊店裡吃冰淇淋.

title: Mercury's Diamonds

content.en: Space looks empty! What's out there? Well, there are planets, moons, stars, and more. Are there aliens? Hmmmm ... Are there diamonds? Yes, you heard that right: diamonds!
content.tw: 太空看起來空蕩蕩的，有些什麼東西呢? 有行星、衛星、恆星等等。會有外星人嗎?還是鑽石?

content.en: Scientists are studying Mercury. Mercury is the closest planet to the sun. It has a lot of carbon. It's gray because of carbon. There's carbon inside Mercury too.
content.tw: 科學家研究離太陽最近的水星，發現它有很多碳，地底下也有，所以水星是灰色的。

content.en: What happens when carbon is pressed very hard in a very hot place? Diamonds are made!
content.tw: 碳在溫度極高的地方被緊緊擠壓，會發生什麼事? 會變成鑽石。

content.en: Billions of years ago, Mercury was very hot. The carbon inside Mercury was pressed very hard. So scientists think maybe diamonds were made. They think the diamonds are in a layer.
content.tw: 幾十億年前，水星的溫度非常高，碳又在高壓狀態。科學家認為水星的一個地層裡面可能蘊藏了很多鑽石。

content.en: The diamond layer is very thick. Scientists think it is fifteen to eighteen kilometers thick! That's a lot of diamonds! But don't get too excited! We can't wear these diamonds.
content.tw: 鑽石層非常厚，科學家認為大約有15到18公里的厚度，那可是很多很多的鑽石哦。但是先別高興，我們沒辦法佩戴這些鑽石。

content.en: These diamonds are five hundred kilometers deep down inside Mercury. We can't get them.
content.tw: 因為這些鑽石埋在水星地底下深達500公里，我們拿不到。

content.en: Learning about Mercury's diamonds helps scientists learn about other planets. What more will they find?
content.tw: 了解水星的鑽石有助於科學家了解其他行星。他們還會發現什麼呢？

vocabulary.preface: 水星上也許有數不清的鑽石，但是距離地球人太遙遠了

content.text:
1. wear 穿戴。
That's a beautiful ring! 好漂亮的戒指!
This is the first time I see you wearing it. 這是我第一次看你戴。
Yeah, it's from my boyfriend. 是啊，我男朋友送的。

2. excited 興奮的。
A diamond ring from him?! 他送鑽戒?!
Yeah, I got very excited when he gave it to me. 對啊，他送我時我好興奮呢!

3. think 想。
So did he propose? 所以他有求婚嗎?
Not yet. 還沒有。
What's he waiting for? 他在等什麼?
I think he wants to buy a house first. 我想他要先買房子。

4. carbon 碳。
Well, a diamond is a diamond. 鑽石總是鑽石。
Yeah, although it's just hard-pressed carbon. 對，雖然它只是被用力擠壓的碳。

vocabulary.postscript: 請注意，來一起讀今天的單字。wear穿戴 excited興奮的 think想 carbon碳

title: Stretching Helps Your Body

content.en: Eight, nine, ten… phew! Exercise is hard work! But kids in Taiwan need more exercise. It's very important for good health.
content.tw: 呼! 運動很辛苦，但台灣的小孩需要做更多運動，這對健康非常重要。

content.en: Do you know two important things to do when you exercise? They are warming up and stretching!
content.tw: 當你做運動時有兩件很重要的事: 就是暖身和拉筋!

content.en: A researcher says to warm up first. You can walk, jog, or ride a bike. Warm up for five to ten minutes. Then you are ready to move more!
content.tw: 專家說可以先走路、慢跑或騎腳踏車暖身，大概五到十分鐘，這樣你就準備好做更多運動。

content.en: Stretching helps your body move more easily. Some people say to stretch before exercising. Others say to do it after.
content.tw: 拉筋會讓你身體更靈活，有人說應該在運動前做，有人說在運動後。

content.en: The researcher says both can be good! But you need to know how to stretch. And don't stretch until you hurt! If you hurt, stop!
content.tw: 專家說兩種都很好! 但是你要知道怎麼拉筋，不要拉到受傷，如果拉傷了就要停下來!

content.en: Here's one way to stretch. You stand up. Keep your legs straight. Then reach for your toes. Don't move... for one minute!
content.tw: 這裡有個拉筋的好方法: 你站起來，保持你的腿是直的，然後手往腳趾頭延伸，保持一分鐘不動!

content.en: The researcher says to stretch one minute for each group of muscles. That's not too long. You won't get tired. And your body gets a good stretch! You'll feel good!
content.tw: 專家說每個肌肉群只要拉筋一分鐘，時間不算太長，你不會感到疲憊。你的身體會得到很好的伸展！你會感覺很棒！

content.en: Warming up, stretching, and exercising can help you be healthy! Try a good stretch now!
content.tw: 暖身、拉筋和運動能幫助你保持健康！現在就來好好伸展一下吧！

vocabulary.preface: 拉筋是暖身的一部份，可以預防運動傷害。

content.text:
1. first 首先。
Alright, Jane, before we start, we need to stretch
first.我們開始之前先得來伸展。
Ugh, do we have to? 一定要嗎?
Yes, we do. You'll see. 一定要，你之後會了解。

2. toe 腳趾。
Stand up straight, and then try touching your toes. 站直，然後試著碰你的腳趾。
My toes? I can hardly touch my knees! 腳趾? 我連膝蓋都幾乎碰不到!

3. muscle 肌肉。
You can do it, Jane. 你做得到。
Good job! Let's do it again. 做得很好，再來一次。
Stretch your muscles and touch your toes! 伸展肌肉，手碰腳趾。

4. body 身體。
My body will thank me later, right? 我的身體以後會感謝我，對吧?
Exactly! 正是!

來讀今天的單字。

title: Learning How to Use a Phone

content.en: What did you do when you got your first smartphone? Did you read about how to use it? Did you ask someone for help?
content.tw: 第一次有智慧型手機時，你做了什麼？有人教你嗎?

content.en: Or, maybe you didn't need any help! Maybe you saw your mom or dad use their phones and learned.
content.tw: 還是你看爸媽怎麼用就學會了呢?

content.en: But many older people don't know how to use smartphones. They don't know about apps. Their children and grandchildren can't text or video call them. This makes them sad.
content.tw: 但是，很多長輩不知道怎麼使用手機。不會用手機講話或跟家人視訊，讓他們很難過。

content.en: But India has a program. It teaches people how to use smartphones.
content.tw: 印度現在有一堂課在教大家怎麼用手機！

content.en: The oldest student is 105 years old. He started one year ago. Before, he read the news in newspapers. And he could not video call his family.
content.tw: 有一位學生已經105歲了！他一年前才開始上這堂課，他以前沒辦法在手機上看新聞或是跟家人視訊。

content.en: Now he watches the news online. And he knows how to video call his family! This makes him happy!
content.tw: 上了這堂課之後，他不但能跟家人視訊，也會上線看新聞！

content.en: It's International Literacy Day today! Literacy is about reading. It's about using smartphones to read and do other things too! Using a smartphone helps this man. Can you teach someone how to use one? Share what you know and help them!
content.tw: 今天是國際掃盲日！掃盲是關於閱讀。它也關乎使用智慧型手機閱讀和做其他事情！使用智慧型手機對這位男士很有幫助。你能教別人如何使用它嗎？分享你所知道的並幫助他們！

vocabulary.preface: 智慧型手機功能眾多，其實大家都需要學習。

content.text:
1. newspaper 報紙。
My newspapers didn't arrive this morning. 我的報紙今天早上沒來。
You're still reading print newspapers?! 你還在看紙本的報紙喔?
Yeah, it's easier for me. 是，對我來說比較簡單。

2. online 線上。
But you can read news online. 但是你可以上網看新聞。
Just get an app. 下載一個應用程式。

3. need 需要。
I tried but I needed help from my children. 我有試，但是需要孩子幫忙。Did they help? 他們有幫上忙嗎?
No, they said I could ask my grandchildren. 沒有，他們說我可以去問孫子孫女。

4. learn 學習。
You know you can learn from AI, right? 你知道可以跟AI學吧?
Will it teach me step by step? 會一步一步教我嗎?
Yeah, it will. 會。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字很簡單。
newspaper報紙 online線上 need需要 learn學習

title: Killer Frog Cancelled in North Carolina

content.en: Guys! Be careful… That’s an African clawed frog! That thing’s a killer! RUN!!! …
Phew! Those frogs are very scary! They eat any animal they can. ANY animal!
content.tw: 這是非洲爪蛙，牠們很恐怖，什麼動物都吃。

content.en: Listen to this scientist… Scientist: “I haven’t found anything they won’t eat… bugs and snails, tadpoles, other frogs, small fish… anything! Left alone… they would kill everything until you’d only find the clawed frog left. Then they’d begin eating each other.”
content.tw: 科學家說，非洲爪蛙什麼都吃，包括昆蟲、蝸牛、蝌蚪、其他的青蛙、小魚等等。如果你把非洲爪蛙放在一起，牠們會把所有的動物殺光，然後開始吃同類！

content.en: African clawed frogs have long, sharp claws.They use them to rip up other animals!
content.tw: 非洲爪蛙有又長又尖銳的爪子，可以撕開獵物的身體。

content.en: In just 4 months this killer frog can lay thousands of eggs. The eggs turn into tadpoles. Some tadpoles become frog food…
content.tw: 這種青蛙四個月之內就可以生下好幾千顆卵，這些卵會孵化成蝌蚪，再變成更多非洲爪蛙！

content.en: These frogs smell very bad! They taste bad too. So no other animals eat them.
content.tw: 牠們又難聞又難吃，所以沒有動物會吃。

content.en: They’re hard to catch. They’re really fast swimmers. They can hold their breath for a loooong time. And they can swim backwards!
content.tw: 牠們游得很快，憋氣可以憋很久，還會倒退游，所以很難抓！

content.en: North Carolina is a state in the USA. It thinks this frog is very, very scary. It’s illegal to have an African clawed frog in North Carolina.
content.tw: 美國的北卡羅萊納州覺得這種青蛙太恐怖了，決定立法禁止人們養這種青蛙。

content.en: So if you live in North Carolina, or anywhere, stay away from African clawed frogs!
content.tw: 所以如果你住在北卡羅來納州，或任何地方，都請遠離非洲爪蛙！

vocabulary.preface: 這種青蛙侵略性太強，已經成為禍害。

content.text:
1) African 非洲的。
Africa… I’ve only read about it in books. 非洲，我只在書本裡面讀過。
Yeah? There are many African countries worth a visit. 是嗎?
有很多非洲國家值得一遊。

2) animal 動物。
How many have you been to? 你去過幾個?
Just three. 只有三個。
And I think I saw hundreds of animals. 我想我看到了好幾百個動物。

3) careful 小心的。
That's amazing! 真驚人!
Yeah, but you have to be very careful. 對，不過要很小心。
Wild animals can be dangerous.野生動物會危險。

4) swimmer 游泳者。
Did you know that tigers are good swimmers? 你可知老虎很會游泳?
No, I didn’t. 我不知。
They are. 真的。
A tiger once almost caught me in the river. 有一次一頭老虎差點在河裡抓到我。

title: South Korea Doesn't Waste Food

content.en: Oh no! The kids didn't eat all their lunch! Did you know that food that is not eaten is called "food waste"?
content.tw: 糟了，這些孩子們沒有把午餐吃完，你知道剩下的食物就會變成廚餘了嗎!

content.en: We make a lot of food waste! All the world's food waste in one day can make one billion meals! Wow!
content.tw: 我們每天製造很多廚餘，全世界一天的廚餘量相當於十億份餐點!

content.en: We throw away a lot of food. When it goes to landfills, it makes gases that make the Earth hotter.
content.tw: 廚餘被丟到垃圾掩埋場，會產生溫室氣體，讓地球的溫度升高。

content.en: But in South Korea, people don't throw away food waste. The country recycles 98 percent of it. That's five million tons of food recycled every year!
content.tw: 但是在南韓，人們不會把食物丟掉，這個國家回收百分之 98 的廚餘，一年回收 500 萬噸的食物!

content.en: Families pay to recycle their food waste. They pay about 200 Taiwan dollars a month. They put the food in food waste bags or cans. If they don't, they may have to pay up to twenty-five thousand Taiwan dollars!
content.tw: 南韓的家庭一個月會付相當於台幣 200 元的費用，回收廚餘，他們把廚餘放到專用的袋子或桶子裡，如果不這麼做，最高可能會被罰相當於兩萬五千台幣的罰款!

content.en: What happens to this waste? Some feeds animals. Some becomes fertilizer. It helps vegetables grow better. A lot makes biogas. Biogas helps make electricity.
content.tw: 這些廚餘有什麼用處呢? 有一些用來當作動物飼料，有一些變成種蔬菜的肥料，還有一些用來製造沼氣，沼氣可以發電。

content.en: South Korea is making good things with its food waste! That makes less bad gases for the Earth. Can Taiwan do this too?
content.tw: 南韓正在用廚餘做很多好事！這樣地球產生的有害氣體就更少了。台灣也能這樣做嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 在南韓，吃剩的東西不會進垃圾桶，必須回收。

content.text:
1) throw away 扔掉.
Every time I cook, I throw away a lot of stuff. 我每次做菜都扔掉好多東西.
So do I. Things like vegetable leaves and eggshells.

2) eaten 被吃掉.
Yeah, they can't be eaten, but I still feel bad about it.
那些不能吃，不過我還是不開心.
For producing too much food waste? 因為製造太多食物垃圾嗎?
Yeah. 對啊.

3) month 月份.
Maybe we shouldn't cook that much. 也許我們不應該太常做菜.
Oh, I only do it once a month. 我每個月只做一次.
Once a month?! 一個月一次?

4) percent 百分比.
Then don't worry.
那你不用擔心.
The waste you produce is less than 1 percent of mine.
你製造的垃圾不到我的百分之一.

title: Guardian of the Gas Station

content.en: Narrator: There's a brave dog in Peru. He is a hero at a gas station!
content.tw: 祕魯的一個加油站裡，有一隻勇敢的狗狗英雄!

content.en: The dog was a stray dog. He didn't have a home. He was thin, and he was hungry all the time.
content.tw: 牠本來是一隻無家可歸的流浪狗，而且一直挨餓。

content.en: Some kind workers at a gas station started giving him food. So the dog loves to go there.
content.tw: 有一些加油站員工會餵給牠食物，所以牠很愛跑去加油站。

content.en: One day, something very scary happened! Two bad people tried to take things from the gas station. Robber 1: Put the money in the bag! Narrator: They were robbers! But the dog came to the rescue!
content.tw: 有一天，兩個可怕的搶匪到加油站搶劫! 這時候，狗狗英雄出現了!

content.en: The robbers tried to scare the dog … Robber 2: Shoo! Go away! Narrator: … But he was brave! He barked loudly. He chased the robbers away! The workers were very thankful for the dog!
content.tw: 搶匪試著把牠嚇走，但牠很勇敢，邊叫邊把搶匪趕跑! 員工們都很感謝牠。

content.en: Now the dog is a guard at the gas station! He wears a red shirt with yellow sleeves. The workers wear a red shirt with yellow sleeves too! He wears an ID card with his picture.
content.tw: 現在這隻狗是加油站的警衛! 牠和其他員工一樣穿著制服，還有貼著牠的照片的員工證。

content.en: He has a nice doghouse. And now he gets breakfast, lunch, and dinner every day!
content.tw: 牠現在有家可以住，三餐也都吃得飽飽的!

content.en: This brave dog is an important worker at the gas station. He keeps everyone there safe!
content.tw: 這隻勇敢的狗狗是加油站的重要員工，牠保護著那裡的每個人安全！

vocabulary.preface: 祕魯一隻流浪犬，救了加油站。

content.text: 1. breakfast 早餐. Guess who showed up for breakfast today? 猜猜看今天誰來吃早餐? Please tell me it wasn't another stray dog! 請告訴我不是另外一隻流浪狗!
2. stray dog 流浪犬. It was! But this stray dog is different. 牠是耶，不過這隻流浪狗不一樣. All of them are the same for me. 牠們對我來說都一樣.
3. bark 叫喊. No, no, this one was very friendly. 不，這隻狗很友善. It barked loudly as if saying "Hello"! 牠大聲叫，好像在說哈囉. I find barking dogs scary. 我覺得一直叫的狗很恐怖.
4. chase away 趕走. I'm thinking of keeping it. 我想要養牠. It can chase away thieves. 牠會趕走小偷. I'll move away before it does that. 我會在牠那樣做之前搬家.

title: Clothes Made of Human Hair Are Good for the Earth

content.en: I want to buy a new sweater. But I don't want to buy a cotton one. Cotton needs chemicals to grow faster. It needs chemicals that kill bugs. These chemicals are bad for the Earth.
content.tw: 我想買新的毛衣，但我不要棉花做的。棉花需要化學物質才能除蟲、長得快，可是化學物質對地球有害。

content.en: Should I buy one made from polyester? No, thanks! Polyester makes microplastics. They're bad for the Earth… and us.
content.tw: 那要買聚酯纖維做的嗎？也不行! 因為聚酯纖維會製造塑膠微粒，對地球跟我們也有害。

content.en: How about a sweater made of … human hair!? It sounds gross, but I heard it feels very soft!
content.tw: 那用人類頭髮做的毛衣呢？感覺有一點噁心，但是聽說摸起來好柔軟。

content.en: We take care of our hair every day. Some of us spend lots of money on our hair. But when we get haircuts, we don't want the hair that's cut off. Thousands of tons of hair become waste! But now, one company wants this hair!
content.tw: 我們每天都會保養頭髮，有一些人還會花很多錢保養。但是當我們把頭髮剪了，就不會想留下來。上千噸的頭髮變成垃圾，現在有一間公司卻想要這些頭髮。

content.en: A Dutch woman's company makes cloth from human hair. Her company gets hair from hair salons and washes it. The company makes yarn from the hair. It can color the yarn almost any color. It makes cloth from the yarn.
content.tw: 一位荷蘭女士開了一間用頭髮做衣服的公司。她的公司從髮廊收集頭髮，並且清洗乾淨做成各種顏色的毛線，再織成布料。

content.en: Hair doesn't need water, land, or chemicals. Using it cuts waste.
content.tw: 頭髮不需要水、土壤或化學物質，使用它可以減少垃圾做環保。

content.en: Maybe one day we'll be wearing clothes made from our own hair!
content.tw: 也許有一天我們會穿著用自己頭髮做的衣服！

vocabulary.preface: 用人類頭髮來做衣服，原料取之不盡用之不竭。

1. haircut 剪髮
I really need to get a haircut. 我真的得去剪頭髮.
It looks fine to me. Soft and shiny. 我看它很好啊。又軟又亮.

2. take care of 照顧
But taking care of it every day is too much trouble.但是每天照顧頭髮好麻煩.
I get it. So you want to cut it short? 我懂，所以你想剪短?

3. grow 生長
Yeah, much shorter.對，短很多.
My hair grows fast. 我的頭髮長很快.
Pretty soon it'll become long again. 沒多久又變長了.

4. company 公司
You can sell your hair to a fashion company, you know. 你可以把頭髮賣給時尚公司，你知道吧.
And a wig company, too! 還有假髮公司呢.
Great idea. 好主意!

title: Will Taiwan Have Longer, Hotter Summers?

content.en: Oh boy, it's so hot. Let's go for a drive to cool down.
content.tw: 天啊，真的好熱。我們去開車兜風。

content.en: Ugh. There are so many cars on the road. Hey, we need to get some gas!
content.tw: 路上有好多車，而且我們還需要加油！

content.en: Summers are hot in Taiwan. We turn on air conditioners to cool down. Maybe we go for drives and use gas. When we do these things, we use fossil fuels.
content.tw: 台灣的夏天真的很熱，我們都會開冷氣或是開車出去兜風，都會用到化石燃料。

content.en: What happens if our fossil fuel use doesn't change? Climate change will make Taiwan's summers hotter and longer.
content.tw: 如果我們不減少化石燃料的使用，氣候變遷會讓台灣的夏天又長又熱。

content.en: By the year 2100, our summers will be 210 days long! Noooooo! Do you like 36-degree days? There will be 75 more!
content.tw: 到了2100年，台灣的夏天會長達210天！36度的天氣會多75天喔！

content.en: Climate change will also bring more heavy rain. More floods will happen. There will be fewer typhoons. But... they'll be stronger!
content.tw: 氣候變遷還會帶來強降雨，就會更常淹水。颱風雖然會變少，但是颱風的強度會更強。

content.en: Longer, hotter summers, more floods, and stronger typhoons will make life harder for everyone.
content.tw: 又長又熱的夏天、很多的水災以及強颱都會讓我們的日子不好過。

content.en: We need to do more to slow down climate change. We don't want longer, hotter summers, right? Let's find ways to use less fossil fuels. Seven months of summer is too long!
content.tw: 我們需要採取更多行動來減緩氣候變遷。我們不希望夏天變得更長、更熱，對吧？讓我們尋找減少使用化石燃料的方法。七個月的夏天實在太長了！

vocabulary.preface: 又熱又潮濕的夏天，讓人很難受，而這種日子以後會更多。

content.text:
1. longer 比較長的
Working late today? 今天晚下班?
I'm not working. 我沒有在工作。
I just want to stay at the office longer. 我只想在辦公室待久一點。

2. hotter 比較熱的
To enjoy air conditioning? 享受冷氣嗎?
Exactly! 正是!
It's too hot at home. 家裡太熱了。
It feels like every summer is hotter than the last.
感覺起來每年夏天都比以前熱。

3. harder 更困難
That's so true! 真的是那樣!
And when it rains, it makes daily life harder. 下雨時也讓日常生活更麻煩。

4. change 改變
I used to love summer a lot. 我以前很喜歡夏天。
Not anymore. 現在不了。
Because summer has changed. 因為夏天變了。
Yeah, it has. 對啊，是變了。

title: A VERY Hungry Ghost Festival

content.en: Every year, Taiwan has many Hungry Ghost festivals. It's a very big, very old festival. Some say it's more than two thousand years old! People honor the ghosts of family and friends who died.
content.tw: 台灣很多地方都會過中元節。他大概有超過兩千多年的歷史。每年的中元節，大家會緬懷過世的親人。

content.en: People don't want these ghosts to be hungry. During the year, people give them the foods they love.
content.tw: 為了不讓那些亡靈餓肚子，親人都會定期祭拜。

content.en: There are other ghosts. Maybe they have no family or friends. So nobody gives them food during the year. They are called "Hungry Ghosts." The festival is for them too.
content.tw: 但有一些亡靈在世上沒有親人，一年中沒有人給他們食物，只能挨餓，被稱為「餓鬼」。中元普渡這個節日也是為他們而設的。

content.en: This year, the festival started later than usual. So the ghosts are hungrier than usual! It's a very, very Hungry Ghost Festival!
content.tw: 今年的中元節來得比較晚，孤魂野鬼特別餓!

content.en: Taiwan's biggest Hungry Ghost Festival is in Keelung. People make lots of food for all ghosts. They also give the ghosts other things to make them happy.
content.tw: 台灣最盛大的中元節祭典在基隆。為了讓鬼魂高興，人們會準備各種食物和禮物。

content.en: When it's time for the ghosts to go home, people light lanterns. People take the lanterns to the ocean and put them on the water. The lanterns help the ghosts go home.
content.tw: 祭典結束時，還會在港口邊放水燈，照亮好兄弟回家的路！

content.en: This year, you can also honor the ghosts during the Hungry Ghost Festival.
content.tw: 今年，你也可以在中元節期間祭拜鬼魂。

vocabulary.preface: 中元節是重要的民俗節日，今年落在九月六號。

content.text:
1. die 死亡。
I'm so hungry I could die. 我快餓死了。
Careful, if you die, you'll come back as a ghost.
小心哦，你假如真的死了，會變成鬼回來。
At least ghosts don't get hungry. 至少做鬼不挨餓。

2. hungry 飢餓的。
From what I heard, they do. 我聽到的是他們也會餓。
That's why we have the Hungry Ghost Festival. 這是為什麼我們有餓鬼節。
That's the English name. 那是英文名字。

3. food 食物。
It's called the Zhongyuan Festival in Chinese. 中文叫做中元節。
But you offer food to the spirits that day, right?
但是那一天你會拿食物祭拜亡靈，對吧?

4. friend 朋友。
Yes. Rice, fruit and chicken. 對，有米飯，水果，還有雞。
Ghosts have friends, too. 鬼也是有朋友的。

title: Arizona Baseball Team Will Have a Taiwan Day

content.en: Do you know someone who lives in Arizona? It's in the U.S. Thirty thousand people from Taiwan live in Arizona. And Arizona loves them!
content.tw: 你可聽過美國的亞利桑那州?台積電在美國的工廠就設在那裡，有三萬多名台灣人住在那裡。

content.en: Arizona has a baseball team. This month, the team is having a Taiwan Day! Forty-eight thousand people can go! Many will learn more about Taiwan. Everyone will have lots of fun!
content.tw: 亞利桑那州的職棒隊伍是響尾蛇隊，他們九月20號比賽當天要舉行[台灣日]，會有四萬八千名觀眾一起同歡。

content.en: Fans can buy baseball shirts for Taiwan Day. The shirts have "Taiwan" and "8" on the back.
content.tw: 粉絲可以買上面寫著台灣和8這個數字的球衣。

content.en: Fans can watch a pop group sing and dance! The six young women are cool! Five are from Taiwan!
content.tw: 來自台灣的流行樂團「幻藍小熊」也會表演，六名團員中有五個是來自台灣。

content.en: Then fans can watch the game. A Taiwanese man will throw the first ball. He was a great baseball player in Taiwan!
content.tw: 比賽將由台灣的棒球名人張泰山開球!

content.en: Many fans will look for player number seven. That's Corbin Carroll. His mom is from Taiwan! Corbin is very fast! He's great at stealing bases! And he hits lots of home runs!
content.tw: 很多粉絲也會尋找背號是七號的外野手卡洛爾，他的母親是台灣人，他很會盜壘，也打出過好多次全壘打!

content.en: The team had a Taiwan Day last year. People wanted a Taiwan Day this year too. Baseball is helping Taiwan and Arizona be good friends!
content.tw: 該隊去年舉辦了台灣日。人們今年也希望有台灣日。棒球正在幫助台灣和亞利桑那州成為好朋友！

vocabulary.preface: 很多台灣人移居美國亞利桑那州，那裏的棒球隊也注意到這一點。

content.text:

I hope we can see three home runs tonight! 我希望今天看到三支全壘打.

2. fast 快速的.
He was so fast the last time he hit one! 他上次打到時速度超快的!

Have you ever thought of being a baseball player? 你有想過當棒球選手嗎?
Me? Half of the time I didn't know where the ball was! 我?
一半的時間我都不知道球在哪裡!

4. look for 尋找.

title: Earth's Hot, Dry Twin

content.en: Four and a half billion years ago, Venus and Earth were born together. They looked almost the same. They both had blue oceans and green mountains. They were twin planets!
content.tw: 45億年前，金星跟地球一起誕生。兩個星球看起來幾乎一樣，都有藍色的大海和綠色的山，簡直是雙胞胎!

content.en: Earth is the right distance from the sun. Earth's oceans are full of water. Earth is warm but not too hot. The air is cool.
content.tw: 地球的海洋充滿水分，又離太陽的距離很剛好，讓地球很溫暖又不會太熱，空氣也很涼爽。

content.en: But Venus is too close to the sun. The sun's heat made Venus' oceans lose water.
content.tw: 但是金星離太陽太近了，金星的海洋都蒸發了。

content.en: Venus has a lot of volcanoes. Lots of bad gases came out of them. The gases made the air thick. The thick air kept more heat in. Venus became the hottest planet around the sun!
content.tw: 金星又有很多火山釋放大量的氣體，讓大氣層變得很厚，整個星球又更熱，成為太陽周圍最熱的行星!

content.en: Water is made from hydrogen and oxygen. In the thick air around Venus, hydrogen and oxygen are cut apart. Hydrogen goes into space. With no hydrogen, Venus cannot have more water. Now it's Earth's hot, dry twin.
content.tw: 水是由氫氣跟氧氣組成。金星的大氣層讓氫氣釋放到太空中。沒有氫氣，金星就沒有水，就變成現在地球又熱又乾的雙胞胎。

content.en: Scientists study Venus to learn how to protect the air and oceans on Earth. The story of Venus and Earth teaches us to care for our planet.
content.tw: 科學家研究金星是為了學習如何保護地球上的空氣和海洋。金星和地球的故事教導我們要關心我們的星球。

vocabulary.preface: 金星誕生的時候跟地球很像，後來的命運卻大不相同。

content.text:
1. blue 藍色、green 綠色
Look at the photos from the Space Station.你看從太空站拍的照片。
All those blue oceans and green forests. 藍海跟綠色森林。
Yeah, so pretty! 對啊，真美!

2. hottest 最熱的
But it's getting hotter, don't you think?
It sure is.
I bet this will be the hottest summer ever.

3. sun 太陽
I wonder what's wrong with the sun.
The sun is not the problem!
It's us humans on planet Earth.

4. Heat 熱度
Actually I don't mind the heat.
I love ice cream and staying cool in the swimming pool.

title: Cleaning Up the Ocean with AI

content.en: The Pacific Ocean is Earth's biggest ocean. But there is something big and bad there. It is the Great Pacific Garbage Patch. It has a lot of trash. It is as big as forty-four Taiwans!
content.tw: 太平洋是世界上最大的海域，垃圾也特別多。垃圾形成的大片漂流物，有四十四個台灣那麼大！

content.en: This trash has plastic bags, plastic bottles, plastic toys, and more in it. It catches fish and birds.
content.tw: 這些垃圾包括各種塑膠製品，也會困住經過的鳥類跟魚類。

content.en: Sunlight and ocean waves break the plastic. The plastic doesn't go away. But the plastic pieces get smaller and smaller. Fish and birds eat them. They think they are eating food.
content.tw: 塑膠被海浪分解後不會消失。塑膠會變成很小的微粒，然後被鳥跟魚當成食物吃下肚。

content.en: Some people are cleaning ocean trash. They use boats. The boats use big nets. The nets catch the trash. Then the boats bring the trash back to land.
content.tw: 有些人會用船和魚網清理海上的垃圾。這些被撈起來的垃圾會被帶回岸上。

content.en: These people want to catch more trash. So they are using AI now! It looks at lots of information about the ocean. It finds trash. It tells the boats where the trash is. Now the boats can clean up more trash. They can make the ocean safer for animals.
content.tw: 現在，他們開始用AI偵測垃圾在海中的位置。有了這個資訊，船隻可以更快的清理垃圾，確保海洋生物的安全！

content.en: Maybe one day, the ocean will be clean again! Tomorrow is World Cleanup Day. Let's help the ocean become cleaner!
content.tw: 或許有一天，海洋會再次變得乾淨！明天是世界清潔日。讓我們一起幫助海洋變得更乾淨！

vocabulary.preface: 海洋垃圾越來越多，對動物和人類都有影響。

content.text:
1. garbage 垃圾。
Look at all that garbage on the beach! 你看看海灘上的垃圾! It's awful !
真恐怖 !
At least it's on land, not in the ocean. 至少它在陸地上，不在海裡。

2. trash 垃圾。
If there are big waves, it'll get in the water. 假如有大浪，它就在水裡了。
And then it becomes ocean trash. 就變成了海洋垃圾。

3. smaller 比較小。
I know. 我知道啊。
And all those bottles will get smaller and smaller 那些瓶子越變越小…
And eaten by fish! 然後被魚吃掉!
We eat fish… 我們把魚吃下肚...

4. clean up 清理。
It'll be like we're eating a lot of microplastic. 就好像在吃一堆塑膠微粒。
Let's clean up the trash. 先清這些垃圾吧。
You're right. 你說對了。

vocabulary.postscript: 今天學到哪些單字? garbage垃圾 trash垃圾 smaller比較小 clean up清理

title: One Hundred Dogs Run in Shopping Mall

content.en: PA System: "Attention shoppers. One hundred dogs are running everywhere in the mall! We're very sorry. We're catching them as fast as we can!"
content.tw: PA系統：「各位顧客請注意。一百隻狗狗正在購物中心裡到處亂跑！我們非常抱歉。我們正在盡快捕捉牠們！」

content.en: Narrator: Huh? Where did the dogs come from? Well, in this shopping mall in China, there's a pet cafe?. That's where one hundred friendly huskies work. But one day, someone forgot to close the door!
content.tw: 這些狗從哪裡來的呢?這座中國的購物中心有一間寵物咖啡廳，裡面有100隻喜歡跟人親近的哈士奇。但是有一天，咖啡廳的門忘了關。

content.en: The dogs left their jobs! They ran out of the pet cafe?!
content.tw: 那些狗狗居然就翹班了，跑出咖啡廳。

content.en: The huskies were very happy! They wagged their fluffy tails! They woofed. They jumped! Some of them got snacks... without paying!
content.tw: 哈士奇非常開心，牠們搖著尾巴、跳來跳去，有的還免費拿到零食。

content.en: The mall became a doggy playground. The shoppers were surprised! Some shoppers were happy to see the huskies. But other shoppers were scared of them.
content.tw: 購物中心變成狗狗的遊樂場。民眾都嚇了一跳，有一些人很開心看到這些狗狗，但有人會害怕。

content.en: The huskies played and played! The pet cafe? workers tried to catch them. Kind shoppers helped too. But the dogs ran here and there. It took one hour to catch them!
content.tw: 咖啡廳的員工試著把牠們抓回去，也有熱心的民眾幫忙，花了一個小時才抓完。

content.en: Phew! Good doggie.
content.tw: 呼！乖狗狗。

content.en: PA System: "Good afternoon shoppers, you can enjoy shopping again. The dogs had fun, but now they're all back at work! Hey! Aaaaahhhhh!"
content.tw: PA系統：「各位顧客午安，您可以再次享受購物樂趣。狗狗們玩得很開心，但現在牠們都回去工作了！嘿！啊啊啊啊啊！」

vocabulary.preface: 購物商場裡面有許多哈士奇亂跑，是不是很有趣的景象?

content.text:
1. friendly 友善的
I think huskies are the most beautiful dogs! 我覺得哈士奇是最漂亮的狗狗!
I find their eyes not so friendly. 牠們的眼睛不那麼友善。

2. scared 害怕
Are you kidding? Their eyes are pretty! 你在開玩笑吧? 牠們的眼睛很美!
They are icy blue, and I'm scared of them. 牠們的眼睛是冰冷的藍色，我很害怕。

3. fluffy 蓬鬆的
But look at their fluffy coats and white legs.
但是你看牠蓬鬆的皮毛跟雪白的腿。
Don't you think they are cute? 你不覺得牠們很可愛嗎?

4. jump 跳
I do like their puppies. 我是喜歡小狗。
I enjoy seeing them jumping around. 我喜歡看牠們跳來跳去。

Do you like huskies? Let's read today's vocabulary.
friendly 友善的
scared 害怕
fluffy 蓬鬆的
jump 跳

title: Every Day Is a Radio Day

content.en: Long ago, people had no cellphones. There was no social media. There was no Internet! In Taiwan, there were no TV stations!
content.tw: 很久以前，人們沒有手機、網路跟社交媒體。那時候，台灣也沒有電視台。

content.en: How did the news travel to people far away? There was radio then. And there's radio now!
content.tw: 那要怎麼讓在很遠地方的人知道新聞呢？當時就是用收音機，現在也是！

content.en: Radio is free! It's on every day, 24 hours a day. Radio stations broadcast news, talk shows, music, stories, and more.
content.tw: 廣播不僅免費而且每天24小時都有。廣播電台播送新聞、談話節目、音樂、故事等等。

content.en: We hear voices and sounds on the radio. We imagine how people, places, and things look or what people are doing. That's why radio is called the "theater of the mind."
content.tw: 我們聽收音機，想像人、事、物的畫面或者人們在做什麼。

content.en: Radio broadcasts big news because radios are reliable. No Internet? No electricity? No problem! Radios can still work! In emergencies, we hear about what's happening and learn what to do.
content.tw: 即使缺電、沒有網路，廣播還是可以運作，所以利用它播送重大新聞。緊急的時候，我們還是可以知道發生了什麼事以及該如何應對。

content.en: Radio brings us all kinds of music. Listening to many songs lets us find out what we like. Some songs become part of our memories!
content.tw: 我們也可以從收音機聽到各種音樂，找到自己喜歡的歌曲。有一些歌曲還會成為我們的回憶！

content.en: Every day is a radio day! Radio broadcasts all the news. Radio gives music to our daily lives. Radio is for all of us!
content.tw: 每天都是廣播日！廣播傳播所有新聞。廣播為我們的日常生活帶來音樂。廣播屬於我們所有人！

vocabulary.preface: 廣播曾經是生活重要的一部份。

content.text:
1. music 音樂
What's that music? 那是什麼音樂?
"A Summer Place," from the 1970s.〈夏日地方〉，1970年代的。
It's very nice. 很好聽。
Yeah, we used to listen to music on the radio. 對，我們以前都從收音機聽音樂。

2. song 歌曲
Not vinyl records? 不是黑膠唱片?
Those came later. 那些以後才出現。
Radio was the thing for Western pop songs. 收音機才有西洋流行歌曲。

3. talk show 談話節目
Were there talk shows? 有談話節目嗎?
No, but there were radio dramas of ghost stories. 沒有，不過有鬼故事話劇。

4. every day 每天
I was glued to my radio every day. 我每天都黏著我的收音機。
For the ghost stories? 聽鬼故事?
For those and more. 聽那些跟其他的。

title: From Wild Goats to Pet Goats?

content.en: A small Italian island has about 100 people. It also has about 600 wild goats!
content.tw: 義大利的一座小島有差不多100位居民跟600多隻的野生山羊。

content.en: That's too many wild goats! They are a 'biiiig' problem. There isn't enough food for them! Now they go into people's gardens. They eat breakfast, lunch, and dinner there! Goodbye, beautiful flowers, fruits, and vegetables…
content.tw: 野生山羊真的太多了，島上沒有足夠的食物，牠們只好跑進居民的後院吃三餐，漂亮的花、蔬菜水果都沒了。

content.en: The mayor is asking for help! He wants people to take 500 goats from the island. Maybe these wild goats can become their pet goats!
content.tw: 市長希望大家可以幫助他把500隻山羊帶離這座島，或許這些山羊可以成為他們的寵物。

content.en: Getting a goat is easy. People email the mayor. They say they want a goat. The mayor says okay. Then they go and catch a goat!
content.tw: 要領養山羊很簡單，寄電子郵件給市長說想要一隻，市長同意就可以去抓山羊。

content.en: Wait a minute... The island is one tall mountain. It has no roads! It has no cars! It has many, MANY steps. Donkeys carry things up and down. And... goats are VERY good at running up and down mountains.
content.tw: 等等，這座島是一座高山，山上沒有路也沒有車，只有很多的階梯。驢子可以載物品上下樓梯，山羊也很會爬山。

content.en: The mayor gives people fifteen days to catch a wild goat. Why? Hmmm... Maybe getting a pet goat here isn't easy!
content.tw: 市長給人們十五天的時間來抓一隻野生山羊。為什麼？嗯...也許在這裡得到一隻寵物山羊並不容易！

vocabulary.preface: 想要山羊當寵物，看起來困難重重。

content.text: 1. breakfast 早餐. What's for breakfast tomorrow? 明天早飯吃什麼? Let's see…Toast, milk and fruit. 我想想，吐司、牛奶跟水果。 Sounds good. 聽起來不錯。
2. vegetable 蔬菜. And what's for lunch? Just curious. 那中飯呢? 只是好奇。 Maybe some pasta with vegetables. 也許煮點麵條加蔬菜。 Vegetables from our garden? That'll be great! 我們菜園裡的蔬菜嗎? 那很棒!
3. dinner 晚飯. I won't be home for dinner, though. 不過我不會在家吃晚飯。 I'm going hiking on Xiangshan. 我要去象山健行。
4. up and down 上上下下. What's the fun of going up and down that hill? 爬上爬下那座山有什麼好玩的? The weather is so hot. 天氣又這麼熱。 The night view is beautiful! 夜景很漂亮!

vocabulary.postscript: 這些都是常用的單字。 breakfast早餐 vegetable蔬菜 dinner晚飯 up and down上上下下

2. What do the wild goats eat?
3. What do you need to do first to get a goat from the island?

title: Helping Kids Make Friends

content.en: Sammie helps lonely kids. They feel sad… They need a friend. Sammie helps them find friends!
content.tw: Sammie幫助孤單的孩子交朋友。

content.en: How does Sammie help? She gives buddy benches to schools. What are they? Well, buddy means friend. And benches are long seats for two or three people. Buddy benches are seats for friends!
content.tw: Sammie 怎麼幫助他們呢? 她捐好朋友長板凳給學校。Buddy的意思是朋友，Bench 是兩到三個人可以坐的板凳。好朋友板凳就是用來交朋友的。

content.en: How do buddy benches work? When a kid feels lonely, she sits on one. Other kids know she needs a friend. They can sit with her or play with her. They can be friends!
content.tw: 小朋友感到孤單的時候，可以坐在好朋友長板凳上，其他的小朋友就會知道她需要朋友，會跟她坐在一起、跟她玩，成為朋友。

content.en: Sammie learned about buddy benches when she was eight years old. She wanted a bench for her school. She wanted one that was kind to the Earth.
content.tw: Sammie八歲的時候知道好朋友長板凳，她希望她的學校也有，她也希望能夠對地球友善。

content.en: A company takes plastic bottle caps to make plastic benches. So Sammie asked everyone for bottle caps. She got 725 kilograms of caps! That made three buddy benches!
content.tw: 有一家公司把塑膠瓶蓋做成長板凳，所以Sammie跟人家要瓶蓋，收集多達725公斤，然後做了三個長板凳。

content.en: Sammie didn't stop at three benches. She gave more than 200 benches in the USA and one in Africa! And she's still helping!
content.tw: Sammie收集的瓶蓋在美國做了超過200個這樣的椅子，還有一個在非洲。

content.en: Let's have buddy benches in Taiwan and help lonely kids find friends!
content.tw: 讓台灣也有好朋友長板凳，幫助孤單的孩子找到朋友！

vocabulary.preface: 坐在好朋友長板凳上，可以讓人知道你需要朋友。

content.text:
1. sad 悲傷的
Good morning! 早安 !
Hi …
What's the matter? 怎麼了?
You look so sad. 你看起來很難過。
Yeah, I do feel a little down today. 對啊，我今天有點心情不好。

2. sit 坐
I can't find anyone to play with. 我找不到人跟我玩。
I need to go to work in 20 minutes. 我二十分鐘後要去上班了。
But I can sit with you for a while. 但我可以跟你坐一會兒。

3. kind 和善的
That's very kind of you! 你人真好。
So you wanted to play football? 所以你是想玩美式足球?
Yeah. 對啊。

4. want 想要
It's hard to play it all by myself. 很難自己一個人玩。
You're right. I'd want to play football with a friend too.
你說得對，我也會想跟朋友一起打球。

vocabulary.postscript:
你記得今天的單字嗎?
sad悲傷的
sit坐
kind和善的
want想要

title: A Washing Machine for Humans

content.en: Do you sometimes not feel like taking a shower? Wouldn't it be nice if there was some kind of machine that could clean your body?
content.tw: 你會不會有時候懶得洗澡呢？如果這時候有機器可以幫你洗澡，該有多好！

content.en: Imagine this: You get into a machine that looks like a big bathtub. You turn it on, sit back and relax, and 15 minutes later, you're done. Oh, and the machine also dries your hair and your body.
content.tw: 想像你有一個像大浴缸的機器，啟動它、坐下去，然後好好地放鬆。15分鐘後，就洗好了！機器還會幫你弄乾身體跟頭髮。

content.en: You don't have to do anything! Doesn't that sound amazing? Well, here's the best part: it's real! A company in Japan is making washing machines for humans!
content.tw: 這個機器真的存在！日本有一家公司已經推出洗澡機！

content.en: It's going to be really high-tech! The human washing machine will have a super smart computer that knows how to heat water, so it's not too hot and not too cold…just perfect for you.
content.tw: 這個洗澡機很高科技，它有一個超級聰明的電腦，會把水加熱到不太冷也不太熱的溫度--對你來講就會剛剛好的溫度！

content.en: The company wants you to feel calm and relaxed when you are in the human washing machine, so it plays music while it cleans you!
content.tw: 這家公司希望你洗澡的時候可以放鬆，所以這台機器還會邊洗邊放音樂。

content.en: What do you think? Would you like a bath in a human washing machine?
content.tw: 你覺得呢？你會想用人類洗澡機洗澡嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 想洗個澡嗎? 現在也有幫人洗澡的機器囉。

content.text:
1. machine 機器。
I'm so tired today. 我今天好累。
If only I had a washing machine to wash me! 要是有機器來給我洗澡就好了!
There is such a machine, you know. 是有這種機器。

2. wash 洗。
So I just step in the bathtub and do nothing?
所以我只要踏進澡盆，什麼都不用做?
Yeah, the machine can even wash your hair. 沒錯，機器甚至可以幫你洗頭髮。

3. dry 吹乾。
And then it will dry your hair and body. 然後它會吹乾你的頭髮和身體。
Will it put on my pajamas for me? 它會幫我穿上睡衣嗎?
You're asking too much, Paz! 你要求太多了!

4. perfect 完美的。
No, I just want a perfect machine. 不，我只是想要個完美的機器。
All I need to do is lie down and sleep. 我就只需要躺下來睡覺。

vocabulary.postscript: 你想買個洗澡機器嗎? 來讀讀單字。machine機器 wash洗 dry吹乾 perfect完美的

quiz.question: 1. Where is the human washing machine company based?
2. How long will the machine take to wash a human?
3. What does the human washing machine look like?

title: From a Backyard Rocket to a Space Mission

content.en: Narrator: Space is so big. There's always something new to learn.
content.tw: 外太空很大，還有很多新知可以去探索。

content.en: In 2020, a girl from the UK was six years old. On TV, she saw a rocket launch to Mars. Astronaut Liz, or Astro Liz, fell in love with space then.
content.tw: 2020年，英國一位六歲女孩在電視上看到火箭發射到火星，從此之後愛上外太空。

content.en: Astro Liz loves learning about space. She makes videos about space. She posts them online. She shares her learning and excitement with everyone!
content.tw: Liz 喜歡學習太空知識，也製作太空影片放到網路上，分享給大家。

content.en: Astro Liz made a cool rocket in her backyard. She made it with cardboard. The rocket was about two meters tall. Then … Astro Liz: THREE, TWO, ONE, LIFT OFF! Narrator: Yes, the rocket was real! It flew nine meters up in the air! Everyone was surprised!
content.tw: Liz用紙板在後院打造了一個兩公尺高的火箭。還可以發射，火箭飛了9公尺高。

content.en: Astro Liz was seven years old. Space experts saw her rocket video. They liked it very much!
content.tw: 太空專家看到她的火箭影片，他們非常喜歡。

content.en: They asked Astro Liz to join a real space mission! A rocket is taking twenty boxes to the moon. One box is hers. She put an Astro Liz sticker in it.
content.tw: 還邀請Liz參加真的太空任務。有一支火箭要帶二十個箱子到月球，其中一個是 Liz 的，她把自己的貼紙放進箱子裡。

content.en: Learning can take us to wonderful places. Astro Liz's love of learning took her to a space mission!
content.tw: 學習可以帶我們到美好的地方。Liz 對學習的熱愛讓她參與了一項太空任務！

vocabulary.preface: 這個小女孩不但喜歡太空，還會製作火箭。

content.text:
1. space 太空
I'm going to Florida next month. 我下個月要去佛羅里達州。
Cool! Do you plan to see the Space Center? 酷喔。你打算去參觀太空中心嗎?

2. launch 發射
Yeah, isn't it exciting? 對啊，好讓人興奮!
I'll get to see them launch a rocket. 我要去看他們發射火箭。
Really? Where will the rocket go? 真的嗎? 火箭要飛去哪裡?
It's going to the Moon! 要去月球。
